qas.question: How long have humans used domsticated poultry ?

answers.text: domestication of poultry took place several thousand years ago

qas.question: What have people use domesticated poultry for besides food ?

answers.text: cockfighting at first and quail kept for their songs

qas.question: Why did humans feel that addtional breeding tatics were necessary in poulty?

answers.text: Selective breeding for fast growth, egg-laying ability, conformation, plumage and docility took place

qas.question: Has breeding changed the original characterictics of the animals ?

answers.text: modern breeds often look very different from their wild ancestors.

qas.question: How popular is poultry as a consumable among humans ?

answers.text: Poultry is the second most widely eaten type of meat globally

context: The <a0_0>domestication of poultry took place <b6_0><b9_0>several thousand years<b9_0/><b6_0/> ago<a0_0/>. This may have originally been as a result of people hatching and rearing young birds from eggs collected from the wild, but later involved keeping the birds permanently in captivity. Domesticated chickens may have been used for <a1_0><b7_0><b10_0>cockfighting<b7_0/> at first and quail kept for <b8_0>their songs<b10_0/><b8_0/><a1_0/>, but soon it was realised how useful it was having a captive-bred source of food. <a2_0>Selective <b11_0>breeding for fast growth, egg-laying ability, conformation, plumage and docility<b11_0/> <b13_0>took place<a2_0/> over the centuries<b13_0/>, and <a3_0>modern breeds often look very different from their wild ancestors.<a3_0/> Although some birds are still kept in small flocks in extensive systems, most birds available in the market today are reared in intensive commercial enterprises. <a4_0><b5_0>Poultry<b5_0/> is the <b12_0>second most widely eaten type of meat globally<b12_0/><a4_0/> and, along with eggs, provides nutritionally beneficial food containing high-quality protein accompanied by a low proportion of fat. All poultry meat should be properly handled and sufficiently cooked in order to reduce the risk of food poisoning.
